alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 2:12AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Cherokee, southern Barton, northern Newton and Jasper Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 212 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Lamar to near Purcell to near Scammon to Baxter Springs. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Joplin, Carthage, Webb City, Carl Junction, Baxter Springs, Columbus, Galena, Oronogo, Granby, Carterville, Duquesne, Sarcoxie, Duenweg, Jasper, Diamond, Golden City, Loma Linda, Airport Drive, Weir and Leawood. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 0 and 31. Interstate 49 between mile markers 28 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
